> 
> If these new beacons that BLACKARACHNIA was trying to plant were the
=
> equivalent of digital bugle in power outputs, what she was getting
> back=
 was like 'triangles'. It was heavily muted and only good for
> short range=
, perhaps 40 or 50 meters. Actually better than what they
> were getting be=
fore, which was virtually nothing past 10 meters.
> 
> However having said =
that there was still no trace of HYDRAS. If he was
> still alive, he was ou=
t of sensor range.
> 

<NEW>

An improvemewnt in scanning range in the dens=
e jungle underbrush was still useless, given that if they were to come in u=
nder assault by the time an opponent was charging them they might get a res=
posne from it.  But still, it was less negligbly useless than before.

For =
the moment, using WASPINATOR to calibrate, BLACKARACHNIA was able to determ=
ine that HYDRAS was nowhere in the vicinity, with a muttered sense of the C=
YBERTRONIAN language equivalent of 'No Slag NIghtbeat' going through her pr=
ocessor.

And she listened to the commentary tossed out by CRYOTEK with ext=
reme interest now.  He had a point.

And who else had an unknown connection=
 to Unicron..

But Tarantalus?

OOC - Beast Wars wasn't specific on that, b=
ut it was directly stated in the Convention Comics he was a creation of Uni=
cron, to an unknown degree.  So up to you if there's some 'truth' to it, or=
 merely unsubstantiated rumormongering!


> The tunnels appear to be going =
down, the ground sloping down almost
> sharply in spots. The tunnel walls a=
re made completely of stone and
> rock and, at least at this point, look na=
tural. There was still no
> trace of HYDRAS as they went down. However the =
interesting thing was
> that the lower they went the shorter their transpon=
der signal became.
> Whatever it was they were going into, the interference=
 on their
> com-links and transponders was getting stronger.
> 

There was =
a thought of contemplation in the tunnels from VICE GRIP.  "There's some so=
rt of jamming boundary or interference zone the deeper we go, the less rang=
e we have."

Wondering if there was a lower 'sheathe' to the jamming zone, =
he attempted to use his commsignal to try and 'bounce' back the signal, as =
if using echolocation to try an dsee if he could locate the 'bottom' of it,=
 in any sense of the word.
